author: mini_mads1980
title: Keeping Lego City Roads Safe
review:
Overview

This month the Lego City Comic gives us yet another member of the Police Force.  This particular one comes with a speed camera and paddle to indicate that cars should stop.  Hopefully the streets of your Lego City will be safer with this addition.  This duty falls to Sam Solo.

Packet

The image of Sam and her speed recording camera fills the front of the foil packet.  The image does not fill you with excitement, but then this set has limited play value and Lego have done the best with what they have.

It says you should be over six for this set, however younger builders will have no problem putting this together.

Minifigure

Sam Solo is the only Minifigure you get with this, although the comic has an older set attached this month.  The parts are quite common and can be obtained from sets ranging in price, with her head appearing in a surprisingly high number of lower priced sets - so it's likely that most Lego cities will already feature this element.  The Police torso is very common too.

The dual moulded hat/hair is probably the best part in this set.

Main Build/Parts

This will take you less than a minute to build.  The sub-build in this pack is only really there to add a few parts and give the Minifigure a role to perform.  They could maybe have included a 4X4 plate to attach the camera rather than the round one, but when connected to a base plate it holds up well enough.  The camera can be positioned in a full 360 degrees, allowing it to track vehicles, due to only connecting to one stud.

Verdict

This is far from my favourite Lego City Comic set, but if you have some of the others it can add an element of play.  By itself however it offers very little play value.  I would not recommend tracking this down if you didn't get it originally - I got two on the front of my comic which makes me think that there was an error somewhere as the comic contained the instructions for the Police Motorbike.  I expect this to appear attached to one of the future comics in 2020 as the additional set.

The comic was £4.99, which is very good value for a comic and two Lego sets.

Next month is back to space with a space buggy.
